comment: @CAP_PhD @brianschatz We'll see how they come out of this.As of now, they haven't said much.I may change my view if they play a key role in prevention of a serious infection/death rate here.
@drachenvogel @brianschatz Its been illegal for the CDC to study gun violence since 1996. Donald Trump flouted CDC recommendations on confirmed Coronavirus patients returning to the US.
Trump is trying to cut CDC by 9 percent in case anyones wondering how they are approaching Coronavirus.

@CAP_PhD @brianschatz There is a pandemic in progress.  No announcement.  I am sure they will soon, but recent flights to the US have needlessly exposed thousands of people.CDC is partly political, such as wasting money non-medical stuff like gun violence.Anyway, Trump is irrelevant in this mess.
@drachenvogel @brianschatz Monitoring deaths from epidemics is literally why the CDC exists. Literally.

@drachenvogel @brianschatz The CDC does vaccine research that does indeed help generate new vaccines. They also survey worldwide infection trends to make recommendations for vaccine production. Your judgment as to their being "behind the curve" is based on what, exactly?

@CAP_PhD @brianschatz Very convincing.  Go to their web site.  Presumably they are breaking the law then.https://t.co/fUE5PzSxJfThis stuff isn't free.  Maybe they don't pay for the studies per se but they waste money reporting on it.

@brianschatz Always Trump.So if the CDC had more dollars, we wouldn't have pandemic in China, Korea, Iran, Italy...?The CDC doesn't even make the vaccines.  And they seem to behind the curve intellectually on this mess.If you want to blame Trump, connect the dots for the rest of us.

@CAP_PhD @brianschatz In any case, the Dickey Amendment, which you are presumably referencing, only stops them from advocating a position, not from researching it.Total waste of money unless you can figure out which microbe makes people willing to take another's life.

@drachenvogel @brianschatz Well, CDC's under Health and Human Services, and gun violence is within their purview. If you want to study gun violence as an epidemic, CDC has the epidemiologists. As for political overreach, how was the Dickey Amendment not a political tool in itself?
